title.narrative: Amplify VoicesFemme et Tic and Kunafoni

description.narrative: he Women and ICT in Consortium with Kunafoni is the facilitator of Link and learning component Voice in Mali for 3 years. Link andlearning is the heart and soul of Voice. Through this component, we stimulate collaboration, listening, learning, documentation, innovation and the application of new knowledge among rightsholders and more broadly with communities and stakeholders. The objective of the Link and learning component project is to amplify in an innovative and inclusive way the voices of the many rightsholders through capacity building, lobbying, awareness-raising, empowerment, advocacy, denunciations, among others; but also to share through documentation, linkages and learning. The consortium has put ightsholders groups at the heart of the implementation of Voice activities and facilitates the development of communities of practice around issues and challenges that affect them. They are developing a platform to promote inclusive collaboration, including for communities in other regions of Mali. The consortium organizes innovative events and meetings to amplify the voices of rights holders at the local, regional, national and international levels, supported by the production of documents and shareable visuals to deepen learning. Several innovates activities will take in place including : “Handicapable” Festival (1st and 2nd edition), Kunafoni Show-time, communities of practice and stakeholders, publication online and dissemination of 6 rapped debates, Five Dial-in Conferencing, production of two documents in drawings defending the position of VOICE grant partner groups and many other inclusive activities. During the implementation of the Linking and Learning component project,inclusion, respect for personal data and the authorization of participation of people and resources will be done through formal frameworks, to value information that can serve as inspiration for some and as life lessons for others. For sharing and exchanging experiences and information are the keys to success that will weave links towards innovation and learning, especially in the VOICE program in Mali.

participating-org.narrative: Consortuim Femme et Tic et Kunafoni

The association "Women and ICT" and the web TV "KUNAFONI" are two non-profit organizations that work on the women and young people rights , especially marginalized, living with disabilities, victims of abuse, discrimination and or violence. The expertise of "Women and ICTs" is using information and/or the learning lesson in an attractive and innovative way while facilitating its access to the targets, hence the interest of facilitating the link and learning through ICTS. We propose innovative interactive and collaborative solutions that can be adapted to the realities of Mali and that facilitate meetings and ensure better feedback and evaluation of projects. The Association "Women and ICTs" is specialized in the production of digital content andpaper works (books, newspapers, brochures, etc...) through the use of ICTs to promote a better understanding and accessibility of information, especially sensitive information. "KUNAFONI.COM" is a social enterprise that works in the field of human rights through events, information and awareness in the media. It distinguishes itself from other actors through its innovative activities such as the rapped debate, the "Kunafoni Show Time" and wide media coverage in the press (print, radio, TV and online).

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to social and political participation

receiver-org.narrative: Consortuim Femme et Tic et Kunafoni

description.narrative: Civil society actors transformed and strengthened,
CSO actors that build trust and work in inclusive way in coalitions
CSO that improved their acccess to flexible resources to actively address, reclaim and navigate civic space offline and online, involving and considering esp. marginalized groups
CSOs that strengthened the links with their constituencies due to changed ways of working
CSOs with improved risk strategies and improves support when a civic space crisis occurs
CSOs with increased women and youth in leadership positions
informal movements/individuals with access to flexible resources to address, reclaim and navigate civic space offline and/or online
